data.event: The name was changed in 1890 to Santa Rosa (Spanish for "Saint Rose") referring to a chapel that Don Celso Baca (the founder of the city) built and named after both his mother Rosa and Saint Rose of Lima.

event.title: was connected by railroad to Chicago, El Paso, and the world at large in the early 1900s

data.event: Santa Rosa was connected by railroad to Chicago, El Paso, and the world at large in the early 1900s.
